metadata.title: CVE-2012-4445 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Heap-based buffer overflow in the eap_server_tls_process_fragment functionin eap_server_tls_common.c in the EAP authentication server in hostapd 0.6through 1.0 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash orabort) via a small "TLS Message Length" value in an EAP-TLS message withthe "More Fragments" flag set.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-4445` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

hostapd - 1:1.0-3ubuntu2
wpagui - 1.0-3ubuntu2
wpasupplicant - 1.0-3ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wpa package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.0-3ubuntu1').
